resources.string: Desouk is a city in northern Egypt. Located 80 km east of Alexandria, in the Kafr El Sheikh Governorate and had a population of 137,660 inhabitants as of 2011.\nIt is bordered to the west by the Beheira Governorate.\nDesouk dates back to at least c. 3200 BC, the area was part of the ancient city of Buto before the unification of Upper and Lower Egypt. From 1250 to 1517 the city of Desouk was part of the Gharbia province. From 1798 to 1801 it was part of the now defunct Rosetta province
a highly specialized hospital in obstetrics and gynecology and recently it has started anew department in general surgery

Buto, Butus, or Butosus, now Tell El Fara\'in and the village of Ibtu or Abtu near the city of Desouk,Buto was the capital of the lower egypt before the era of unification
The Sidi Ibrahim El Desouki Mosque, better known as El Ibrahimi Mosque, is the largest mosque in Desouk With an area of 7000 square meters. It contains the tomb of Ibrahim El-Desouki.
Church of St. George the Great Martyr bdsouk

Located in Desouq, Egypt, following the Coptic Orthodox Church, it was founded in 1919 by decree of Sultan Fouad I, and was restored in 1967 under the late Egyptian President Gamal Abdel Nasser. The church offers various services to care for the needy and the elderly along with some sports and cultural activities.
The Desouk Bridge is a steel truss bridge carrying the railway across the Lower Nile in Desouk , The bridge was built between 1925 and 1927 with long of 610 meters .
umm Al-Qura Park is the newest park ind desouk it was founded in 2016

Family and Children Park is the oldest park in desouk and has as special section for the children
